frame.name: Criminal_process
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested by <fen>Authorities</fen> on <fen>Charges</fen> related to an <fen>Offense</fen>, then is arraigned as a <fen>Defendant</fen>. If at any time the <fen>Defendant</fen> pleads guilty, then the <fen>Defendant</fen> is sentenced, otherwise the <fen>Defendant</fen> first goes to trial. During trial, the <fen>Defense</fen> and <fen>Prosecution</fen> present arguments on behalf of and against the <fen>Defendant</fen>, respectively. If the <fen>Jury</fen> comes up with a guilty verdict at the end of the trial, the <fen>Defendant</fen> is sentenced. In the end, the <fen>Defendant</fen> is either released or is given a Sentence by a <fen>Judge</fen> at the sentencing.
<ex></ex>
The Core roles in this frame and its subframes include <fen>Authorities</fen>, <fen>Charges</fen>, <fen>Court</fen>, <fen>Defendant</fen>, <fen>Defense</fen>, <fen>Judge</fen>, <fen>Jury</fen>, <fen>Offense</fen>, <fen>Prosecution</fen>, and <fen>Suspect</fen>. Non-Core roles include <fen>Place</fen>, <fen>Time</fen>, <fen>Victim</fen>, and <fen>Witness</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Court
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Court</fen> involved in a trial.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Judge</fen> heads the <fen>Court</fen> where arraignment occurs and the case is tried.</def-root>

FE.name: Prosecution
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the attorney(s) prosecuting the <fen>Defendant</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Charges
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Charges</fen> brought against the <fen>Defendant</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Jury
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the people who are charged by the <fen>Court</fen> to listen to the testimony, evidence, and arguments, and come to a consensus about the guilt or innocence of the <fen>Defendant</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Offense
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Offense</fen> which the <fen>Defendant</fen> is accused of committing.</def-root>

FE.name: Authorities
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody. </def-root>

FE.name: Suspect
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody by the <fen>Authorities</fen>, under suspicion of having committed a crime.</def-root>

FE.name: Witness
FE.definition: <def-root>A person who is present in a courtroom in order to give some form of evidence, has been sworn in, and is being examined by the <fen>Prosecution</fen> or <fen>Defense</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that has in some way been harmed or wronged by the <fen>Defendant</fen>. </def-root>
